events.name: Product Strategy and Product Success with Roman Pichler - Product Camp Singapore
events.description:
Roman Pichler is a leading agile product management and Scrum expert, and the founder of Pichler Consulting. He has more than 10 years experience in  training and coaching product managers and product owners, and a long track record in helping companies apply agile practices to achieve business success.  
Roman is the author of “Agile Product Management with Scrum”. He has created several powerful agile product management and UX tools, and he writes a popular blog on product ownership. 
He is going to deliver a talk on Product Strategy and Product Success. 
  
  
P.S. : Since we have limited seats, please be mindful not to cancel once you register.
events.location: Fusionopolis, , Room Singapore Symbiosis 10936  Level 9, Autodesk Asia Pte Ltd, 3 Fusionopolis Way, #10-21 Symbiosis, 138633, Singapore 138633

events.name: May/2015 - Open Space (Learning)
events.description: Open Space Theme: Learning Open Space Facilitator: Michael Chik from J.P. Morgan Agenda 7:00pm - Food 7:30pm - Generate topics and schedule 8:00pm - Breakout to topic sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology . Getting There Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2 is just right above of Downtown station along Downtown Line (DT) .
events.location: Barclays, 10 Marina Boulevard, #23-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 2, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description: One Thursday a month, 7pm to 10pm PV868 By TeZ 8pm and 9pm Expression Gallery, Level 4 Set your mind free through PV868, an experimental audio-visual performance created by 2015 Art/Science Resident artist, TeZ. Experience the hypnotic effects of moving visual patterns, emerging directly from the interaction of the brainwaves with the sound and light stimulation, unique to each individual. Entry is complimentary and on a first come first served basis. DISCLAIMER: PV868 performance is based on the use of flickering video light which might cause seizures in people suffering of photogenic or photosensitive epilepsy. You should not attend this show if you are already aware of being epileptic and, in any case, the artist cannot be considered responsible of the effects produced by the audio-visual stimulus of this performance. In no case will #TeZ (aka Maurizio Martinucci) or the organizers of this event be liable for chance, accidental, special, direct or indirect damages or undesired effects resulting from partaking the experience of this show.

events.name: talk.js
events.description: The next talk.js will be on Thursday May 7th. Important: the meetup location has moved temporarily to AWS Singapore. Don't fret, it's only a short walk from the old venue. Scheduled Talks: • Build your own CSS Preprocessor with Rework or PostCSS – Melvin Tiong • Types without TypeScript – Tim Oxley • (More TBA) Pizza and drinks will be provided courtesy of AWS. Location: AWS Offices Singapore 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore Remember to bring photo ID to get through building security. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions See you there!
events.location: AWS Offices Singapore, 23 Church Street, Capital Square #10-01, 049481 Singapore
